page.title: 14LANDSCAPE
page.content: THE RIVER WEAVER AND THE RIVER DANE JOIN IN THE CENTRE OF THIS AREA AND WITH CASTLE HILL ENJOYING A VEIW OVER THE WHOLE AREA IT MUST HAVE BEEN AN IDEAL SETTING FOR A SETTLEMENT. SINCE THEN THE AREA HAS BEEN DEVELOPED AND THE LANDSCAPE ALTERED TO A GREATER EXTENT. MAN HAS BEEN THE MAJOR CAUSE OF THE CHANGES.THE SALT AND MORE RECENTLY THE CHEMICAL INDUSTRIES HAVE CHANGED THE LANDSCAPE FROM ONE OF FLAT CHESHIRE PLAINS TO ONE OF WASTE AREAS OF LIME AND COLLAPSED BRINE PITS WHICH HAVE FILLED WITH WATER TO FORM PONDS OR MERES.MANY OF THESE CHANGES IN THE LAND HAVE BEEN IMPROVED AND USED RECENTLY. THE MERES AND PONDS ARE USED FOR RECREATION PURPOSES WHILE THE FLASHES OR LIME BEDS ARE BEING FILLED BY WASTE PRODUCTS.HOPEFULLY THEY WILL FORM PART OF CHESHIRES BEAUTIFUL LAND.
